title: Establishes the prescription drug discount program; repealer
summary: Establishes the prescription drug discount program; establishes that the purpose of the program is to provide access to prescription drugs to participants at a discounted price and to allow for the negotiating of rebates that are exempt from the "best price" rule of the federal social security act; provides for the distribution of rebate funds and repeals a certain provision of the public health law relating thereto.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  public  health law, in relation to creating the
         prescription drug discount program and to repeal certain provisions of
         the public health law relating thereto

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative  findings  and declaration.   The legislature
    2  hereby finds and declares that the high and rising cost of  prescription
    3  drugs  limits  access to those of limited means. It makes it more likely
    4  that they will become eligible for Medicaid, imposing increased costs on
    5  Medicaid.
    6    The legislature therefore declares that it is  an  appropriate  public
    7  purpose  and  in the public interest for New York to exercise the powers
    8  of the state to provide its residents with means and methods of reducing
    9  the high cost of prescription drugs and avoid  increased  costs  to  the
   10  Medicaid  program,  and  that  the  prescription drug assistance program
   11  created by this act is consistent with these public purposes.
   12    The legislature further declares that the purpose of this  act  is  to
   13  help  reduce  the  cost  of and improve access to prescription drugs, by
   14  providing a means to organize and thus maximize  the  market  purchasing

    1  power  of  consumers  to earn revenue from supplier rebates and use that
    2  revenue to make prescription drugs more affordable.
    3    The  legislature  further  declares  its intent that the program, as a
    4  state prescription drug assistance program and  as  a  program  to  help
    5  avoid  increased costs to the Medicaid program, shall be able to negoti-
    6  ate rebates that are exempt from the "best price" rule of title  XIX  of
    7  the federal social security act.
    8    S  2. Sections 270 through 277 of article 2-A of the public health law
    9  are designated title I and a new title  heading  is  added  to  read  as
   10  follows:
   11              PREFERRED DRUG AND CLINICAL DRUG REVIEW PROGRAMS
   12    S  3.  Article 2-A of the public health law is amended by adding a new
   13  title II to read as follows:
   14                                   TITLE II
   15                       PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT CARD
   16  SECTION 280.   DEFINITIONS.
   17          280-A. PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM.
   18          280-B. CONTRACTS.
   19          280-C. REBATES.
   20          280-D. RETAIL DISCOUNT PRICES.
   21          280-E. DISTRIBUTION OF REBATE FUNDS.
   22          280-F. REGISTRATION OF PARTICIPANTS.
   23          280-G. EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.
   24    S 280. DEFINITIONS. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS TITLE,  THE  FOLLOWING  TERMS
   25  SHALL  HAVE  THE  FOLLOWING MEANINGS, UNLESS THE CONTEXT REQUIRES OTHER-
   26  WISE:
   27    1. "CONTRACTOR" IS ANY PUBLIC, PRIVATE, OR NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITY  WITH
   28  WHICH  THE  COMMISSIONER  CONTRACTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADMINISTERING ANY
   29  ELEMENT OF THE PROGRAM OR PROVIDING TECHNICAL OR  CLINICAL  SUPPORT  FOR
   30  THE PROGRAM. THERE MAY BE ONE OR MORE CONTRACTORS.
   31    2.  "COVERED DRUG" MEANS A PRESCRIPTION DRUG THAT IS DESIGNATED BY THE
   32  COMMISSIONER TO BE SUBJECT  TO  PURCHASE  BY  A  PARTICIPANT  UNDER  THE
   33  PROGRAM UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-C OF THIS TITLE.
   34    3.  "FIDUCIARY  RELATIONSHIP" MEANS A RELATIONSHIP IN WHICH ONE PERSON
   35  OR ENTITY IS UNDER A DUTY TO ACT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE OTHER PERSON  OR
   36  ENTITY  IN THE RELATIONSHIP ON MATTERS WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE RELATION-
   37  SHIP, AND OWES A DUTY OF GOOD FAITH, TRUST, CONFIDENCE,  AND  CANDOR  TO
   38  THE OTHER PERSON OR ENTITY.
   39    4.  "MANUFACTURER"  HAS  THE  SAME  MEANING  ASCRIBED  TO SUCH TERM IN
   40  SECTION NINETEEN HUNDRED TWENTY-SEVEN OF  THE  FEDERAL  SOCIAL  SECURITY
   41  ACT.
   42    5.  "PARTICIPANT"  MEANS  A  NATURAL  PERSON WHO MEETS THE ELIGIBILITY
   43  GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED IN SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-F OF THIS TITLE AND
   44  REGISTERS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.
   45    6.  "PARTICIPATING  RETAILER"  MEANS  ANY  PERSON  OR  ENTITY  SELLING
   46  PRESCRIPTION  DRUGS AT RETAIL PRICES THAT IS REGISTERED AS A PARTICIPAT-
   47  ING RETAILER IN THE PROGRAM.
   48    7. "PROGRAM" MEANS THE PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM  ESTABLISHED
   49  BY THIS TITLE.
   50    8.  "REBATE AGREEMENT" MEANS AN AGREEMENT EXECUTED WITH A MANUFACTURER
   51  OR OTHER ENTITY TO PROVIDE REBATES  TO  THE  PROGRAM  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   52  TITLE.
   53    S  280-A. PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM. 1. THE PRESCRIPTION DRUG
   54  DISCOUNT PROGRAM IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED IN THE  DEPARTMENT.  ITS  PURPOSE
   55  SHALL  BE  TO  PROVIDE  ACCESS  TO PRESCRIPTION DRUGS TO PARTICIPANTS AT
   56  DISCOUNTED COST, AND TO OBTAIN APPROPRIATE REBATES  FROM  MANUFACTURERS,

       A. 805                              3

    1  AS  AUTHORIZED  IN  THIS  TITLE. FOR THE PURPOSES OF MARKETING AND OTHER
    2  PURPOSES, THE COMMISSIONER MAY CHOOSE  ANOTHER  NAME  FOR  THE  PROGRAM;
    3  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT  ANY  SUCH CHANGE OF NAME SHALL NOT AFFECT THE
    4  LEGAL  DESCRIPTION  OR INTENT  OF THE PROGRAM, OR ITS EXEMPTION, IF ANY,
    5  FROM THE "BEST PRICE" RULE OF TITLE XIX OF THE FEDERAL  SOCIAL  SECURITY
    6  ACT.  THE  PROGRAM  SHALL  BE  ADMINISTERED  IN  A MANNER THAT MAXIMIZES
    7  SAVINGS FOR THE PARTICIPANTS CONSISTENT WITH THIS TITLE WHILE MINIMIZING
    8  ANY COST TO THE STATE,  INCLUDING  COORDINATING  OR  COMBINING  ADMINIS-
    9  TRATION OF ANY ASPECT OF THE PROGRAM WITH MEDICAID OR EPIC TO THE EXTENT
   10  CONSISTENT WITH THE INTERESTS OF THOSE PROGRAMS AND THEIR PARTICIPANTS.
   11    2.  THE COMMISSIONER MAY REQUIRE EVERY MANUFACTURER PARTICIPATING IN A
   12  REBATE AGREEMENT, EVERY PARTICIPANT AND EVERY PARTICIPATING RETAILER  TO
   13  PROVIDE ANY INFORMATION, AND MAY CONDUCT SUCH AUDITS AND INVESTIGATIONS,
   14  AS REASONABLY NECESSARY FOR EFFECTIVE ADMINISTRATION OF THE PROGRAM. ALL
   15  INDIVIDUAL  IDENTIFYING  INFORMATION RELATING TO ANY PATIENT OR CONSUMER
   16  ACQUIRED BY THE PROGRAM SHALL BE KEPT CONFIDENTIAL BY  THE  COMMISSIONER
   17  AND  SHALL  BE USED SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADMINISTERING THE PROGRAM.
   18  ANY MATTER RELATING TO TRADE OR COMPETITIVE SECRETS OF MANUFACTURERS AND
   19  PARTICIPATING RETAILERS, AND ANY MATTER CONCERNING PRICING  AND  PROFIT,
   20  WHICH  IS  OBTAINED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SUBDIVISION, OR PURSUANT TO ANY
   21  INVESTIGATION OR AUDIT AUTHORIZED PURSUANT TO THIS  TITLE,  OR  OBTAINED
   22  INDIRECTLY  BY  ANY OTHER AUDITS OR INVESTIGATIONS, SHALL BE KEPT CONFI-
   23  DENTIAL.
   24    3. IF THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM REQUIRES ANY FEDERAL  APPROVAL
   25  OR WAIVER, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL EXPEDITIOUSLY APPLY FOR AND USE HIS OR
   26  HER BEST EFFORTS TO OBTAIN SUCH APPROVAL OR WAIVER, CONSISTENT WITH THIS
   27  TITLE AND ANY STATE LAW APPLICABLE TO MEDICAID OR EPIC.
   28    4.  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY  MAKE  REGULATIONS  AND ESTABLISH TERMS AND
   29  CONDITIONS CONSISTENT WITH THIS TITLE  AND  OTHER  APPLICABLE  LAW,  FOR
   30  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM.
   31    S 280-B. CONTRACTS. 1. THE COMMISSIONER MAY CONTRACT WITH, OR AMEND AN
   32  EXISTING  CONTRACT  WITH, ONE OR MORE PUBLIC, PRIVATE, OR NOT-FOR-PROFIT
   33  ENTITIES TO ADMINISTER ANY AND ALL  COMPONENTS  OF  THE  PROGRAM  OR  TO
   34  PROVIDE TECHNICAL OR CLINICAL SUPPORT FOR THE PROGRAM.
   35    2.  (A)  EVERY CONTRACTOR SHALL HAVE A FIDUCIARY RELATIONSHIP WITH AND
   36  OBLIGATION TO THE COMMISSIONER AND THE PROGRAM.
   37    (B) ALL FUNDS RECEIVED BY ANY CONTRACTOR IN RELATION  TO  THE  PROGRAM
   38  SHALL  BE RECEIVED BY THE CONTRACTOR SOLELY ON BEHALF OF THE PROGRAM FOR
   39  USE OR DISTRIBUTION ONLY PURSUANT TO THIS TITLE, INCLUDING THE  CONTRAC-
   40  TOR'S  CONTRACT  WITH THE COMMISSIONER; EXCEPT FOR ANY PAYMENT EXPRESSLY
   41  PROVIDED FOR IN THE  CONTRACT  TO  COMPENSATE  THE  CONTRACTOR  FOR  ITS
   42  SERVICES. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL ACCOUNT TO THE COMMISSIONER FOR ALL FUNDS
   43  RECEIVED AND PROCESSED BY THE CONTRACTOR IN RELATION TO THE PROGRAM. THE
   44  COMMISSIONER  AND  THE  COMPTROLLER  SHALL  HAVE ACCESS TO ALL BOOKS AND
   45  RECORDS OF THE CONTRACTOR IN RELATION TO THE PROGRAM.
   46    (C) THE CONTRACTOR SHALL DISCLOSE TO THE COMMISSIONER  AND  THE  COMP-
   47  TROLLER  THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF ANY CONTRACT OR ARRANGEMENT BETWEEN
   48  THE CONTRACTOR AND ANY PARTY RELATING TO THE PROGRAM.
   49    S 280-C. REBATES. 1. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ENTER INTO AGREEMENTS WITH
   50  MANUFACTURERS TO ACHIEVE  REBATES  FROM  MANUFACTURERS  FOR  THEIR  DRUG
   51  PRODUCTS PURCHASED BY PARTICIPANTS THROUGH THE PROGRAM.
   52    2.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL USE BEST EFFORTS TO MAXIMIZE THE LEVEL OF
   53  REBATES OBTAINED FROM MANUFACTURERS TO THE EXTENT ALLOWABLE  BY  LAW  OR
   54  REGULATION.  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY  SEEK ANY FEDERAL APPROVAL NEEDED TO
   55  ENSURE REBATES RECEIVED UNDER THIS PROGRAM ARE EXCLUDED FROM  THE  DEFI-

       A. 805                              4

    1  NITION  OF  "BEST  PRICE" UNDER SECTION NINETEEN HUNDRED TWENTY-SEVEN OF
    2  THE FEDERAL SOCIAL SECURITY ACT.
    3    3.  TO ADVANCE THE PURPOSES OF THE PROGRAM, THE COMMISSIONER MAY COOR-
    4  DINATE NEGOTIATIONS UNDER THE PROGRAM WITH GOVERNMENTAL AND  NON-GOVERN-
    5  MENTAL ENTITIES, IN THIS STATE OR ELSEWHERE.
    6    4. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL DESIGNATE DRUGS TO BE SUBJECT TO PURCHASE BY
    7  PARTICIPANTS  UNDER  THE PROGRAM. THE COMMISSIONER MAY LIMIT DESIGNATION
    8  UNDER THE PROGRAM TO DRUGS COVERED BY A REBATE AGREEMENT.
    9    5. THE COMMISSIONER MAY SEEK SUPPLEMENTAL REBATES  FROM  MANUFACTURERS
   10  CONSISTENT WITH THOSE REBATES PROVIDED TO THE MEDICAID PROGRAM FOR DRUGS
   11  ON  THE  PREFERRED  DRUG  LIST PURSUANT TO TITLE ONE OF THIS ARTICLE. IN
   12  EXCHANGE FOR THE PROVISION OF SUCH REBATES, THE COMMISSIONER MAY  DESIG-
   13  NATE  SUCH DRUGS AS PREFERRED DRUGS IN PROGRAM MARKETING AND EDUCATIONAL
   14  ACTIVITIES AND  MATERIALS.  THE  COMMISSIONER  IS  AUTHORIZED  TO  LIMIT
   15  PROGRAM  COVERAGE  OF  DRUGS  IN  THERAPEUTIC  CLASSES  INCLUDED  IN THE
   16  PREFERRED DRUG PROGRAM TO THOSE ON THE PREFERRED DRUG LIST.
   17    S 280-D. RETAIL DISCOUNT PRICES. 1. A PERSON OR ENTITY  MAY  BECOME  A
   18  PARTICIPATING  RETAILER  BY  AGREEING  TO  THE  TERMS  AND CONDITIONS OF
   19  PROGRAM PARTICIPATION, AND MEETING QUALIFICATIONS, AS ESTABLISHED BY THE
   20  COMMISSIONER. THE COMMISSIONER MAY REQUIRE PERIODIC RE-REGISTRATION.
   21    2. A PARTICIPATING RETAILER MAY NOT CHARGE A PARTICIPANT A PRICE FOR A
   22  COVERED DRUG WHICH IS HIGHER  THAN  THE  AMOUNT  PAID  BY  THE  MEDICAID
   23  PROGRAM  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-SEVEN-A OF THE SOCIAL
   24  SERVICES LAW, LESS THE APPLICABLE REBATE AMOUNT ADVANCED BY THE  PROGRAM
   25  IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-E OF THIS TITLE.
   26    S  280-E.  DISTRIBUTION OF REBATE FUNDS. 1. THE APPROPRIATE CONTRACTOR
   27  SHALL EXPEDITIOUSLY MAKE PAYMENTS TO  PARTICIPATING  RETAILERS  FOR  THE
   28  ESTIMATED REBATE AMOUNTS, RELATING TO COVERED DRUGS DISPENSED BY PARTIC-
   29  IPATING  RETAILERS TO PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, SUBJECT TO SUBSEQUENT RECON-
   30  CILIATION AGAINST ACTUAL REBATES COLLECTED FROM MANUFACTURERS. RECONCIL-
   31  IATION SHALL NOT REQUIRE RECOUPMENT FROM OR PAYMENTS TO PARTICIPANTS  OR
   32  PARTICIPATING  RETAILERS  FOR  PREVIOUS PURCHASES UNDER THE PROGRAM, BUT
   33  MAY INCLUDE, AS APPROPRIATE, PROVISION FOR ADJUSTMENT AGAINST  ESTIMATED
   34  REBATE AMOUNTS FACTORED INTO FUTURE PRICES TO BE PAID BY PARTICIPANTS.
   35    2.  THE COMMISSIONER MAY MAKE ARRANGEMENTS WITH MANUFACTURERS CONCERN-
   36  ING THE TIMING OR STRUCTURE OF THE REBATE PAYMENTS  AS  IN  HIS  OR  HER
   37  DETERMINATION SHALL BEST FACILITATE LOWER PRICES FOR PARTICIPANTS, EXPE-
   38  DITIOUS PAYMENT OF REBATES AND EFFICIENT ADMINISTRATION OF THE PROGRAM.
   39    S  280-F.  REGISTRATION  OF  PARTICIPANTS.  1.  TO BE ELIGIBLE TO BE A
   40  PARTICIPANT, A PERSON SHALL BE A RESIDENT OF  NEW  YORK,  REGARDLESS  OF
   41  AGE, WHO HAS A HOUSEHOLD INCOME EQUAL TO OR LESS THAN THE GREATER OF (A)
   42  THREE HUNDRED FIFTY PERCENT OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL FOR A HOUSEHOLD
   43  OF  THAT SIZE (AS DEFINED AND UPDATED BY THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF
   44  HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES); OR (B) THE INCOME ELIGIBILITY LEVELS  ESTAB-
   45  LISHED  UNDER SUBDIVISION ONE OR TWO OF SECTION TWO HUNDRED FORTY-TWO OF
   46  THE ELDER LAW, IS NOT IN RECEIPT  OF  MEDICAID,  AND  MEETS  SUCH  OTHER
   47  REQUIREMENTS  AS  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY  ESTABLISH CONSISTENT WITH THIS
   48  TITLE. ANY PERSON ENROLLED IN THE  PRESCRIPTION  DRUG  DISCOUNT  PROGRAM
   49  UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-H OF THIS TITLE SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO BE
   50  A PARTICIPANT UNDER THIS PROGRAM.
   51    2. ANY PERSON ELIGIBLE TO BE A PARTICIPANT MAY BECOME A PARTICIPANT IN
   52  THE PROGRAM BY REGISTERING WITH THE PROGRAM.  ANY PERSON ENROLLED IN THE
   53  PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-H OF
   54  THIS TITLE SHALL AUTOMATICALLY BE REGISTERED BY THE COMMISSIONER IN THIS
   55  PROGRAM.

       A. 805                              5

    1    3.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ADVISE EACH APPLICANT THAT THE PROGRAM DOES
    2  NOT APPLY TO ANY PRESCRIPTION DRUG PURCHASE FOR WHICH REIMBURSEMENT  (IN
    3  WHOLE OR IN PART) IS PROVIDED BY ANY THIRD-PARTY PAYER. THE COMMISSIONER
    4  MAY  REQUIRE PERIODIC RE-REGISTRATION AND MAY REQUIRE THE PARTICIPANT TO
    5  INFORM  THE  PROGRAM  OF  ANY  CHANGE  IN  THE INFORMATION PROVIDED. THE
    6  COMMISSIONER SHALL MAKE THE APPLICATION PROCESS AS SIMPLE AS  REASONABLY
    7  POSSIBLE TO MAXIMIZE PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM CONSISTENT WITH PROPER
    8  ADMINISTRATION OF THIS TITLE.
    9    4.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL REVIEW ALL APPLICATIONS TO DETERMINE IF THE
   10  APPLICANT APPEARS TO MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS  FOR  THE  FAMILY
   11  HEALTH  PLUS  PROGRAM  UNDER  SECTION THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-NINE-EE OF THE
   12  SOCIAL SERVICES LAW, THE CHILD HEALTH INSURANCE  PROGRAM  UNDER  SECTION
   13  TWENTY-FIVE  HUNDRED TEN AND TWENTY-FIVE HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THIS CHAPTER,
   14  OR MEDICAL ASSISTANCE UNDER ARTICLE FIVE OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW.  IF
   15  THE  APPLICANT  DOES  APPEAR TO MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR ANY OF
   16  THOSE PROGRAMS, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL, IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER ACTIONS
   17  TAKEN UNDER THIS TITLE,  PROVIDE  THE  APPLICANT  WITH  INFORMATION  AND
   18  ENROLLMENT  MATERIAL ABOUT SUCH OTHER PROGRAM. HOWEVER, THE COMMISSIONER
   19  SHALL REGISTER THE APPLICANT UNDER THIS  SECTION  IF  THE  APPLICANT  IS
   20  OTHERWISE ELIGIBLE.
   21    S 280-G. EDUCATION AND OUTREACH. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL CONDUCT EDUCA-
   22  TION  AND  OUTREACH  TO  PROMOTE  THE  PROGRAM AND TO ENCOURAGE ELIGIBLE
   23  PERSONS AND ENTITIES TO BECOME PARTICIPANTS AND PARTICIPATING RETAILERS.
   24    S 4. Section 280 of the public health law, as added by section  75  of
   25  part  C  of chapter 58 of the laws of 2008, is renumbered section 280-h,
   26  and amended to read as follows:
   27    S 280-h. Prescription drug discount program.  1. The prescription drug
   28  discount program is hereby established in  the  department.    The  drug
   29  discount  card  shall  be  available to any resident between the ages of
   30  fifty and sixty-four, and any resident of any age who  has  been  deter-
   31  mined  to  meet  the  disability  criteria in 20 C.F.R. S 404.1505, who:
   32  meets the income eligibility levels established under subdivision one or
   33  two of section two hundred forty-two of the elder law; is not in receipt
   34  of medical assistance under title eleven of article five of  the  social
   35  services  law.  The  drug  discount  card  shall offer discounts on drug
   36  purchases which are not covered by other public or private  third  party
   37  payment  sources.    Provided, however, that participation by a provider
   38  pharmacy and drug manufacturers shall be voluntary and reimbursement  to
   39  the  provider  pharmacy  under  the  drug discount card program shall be
   40  adjudicated and paid within two business days for any rebates,  dispens-
   41  ing  fees  and  drug  costs  not  paid by the resident eligible for such
   42  program at the point of sale.
   43    2. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL, AS EXPEDITIOUSLY AS POSSIBLE, INTEGRATE THE
   44  OPERATION OF THE PRESCRIPTION DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM UNDER  THIS  SECTION
   45  WITH  THE  PRESCRIPTION  DRUG DISCOUNT PROGRAM UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED
   46  EIGHTY-A OF THIS TITLE. WHEN THE COMMISSIONER BEGINS REGISTERING PARTIC-
   47  IPANTS UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-A OF THIS TITLE, HE OR SHE SHALL
   48  CEASE ENROLLING PARTICIPANTS UNDER THIS SECTION.  ANY PERSON ENROLLED IN
   49  THE PROGRAM UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL BE AUTOMATICALLY REGISTERED BY  THE
   50  COMMISSIONER  IN  THE PROGRAM UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY-A OF THIS
   51  TITLE.
   52    S 5. Section 280-h of the public health law,  as  amended  by  section
   53  four of this act, is REPEALED.
   54    S  6. Severability.   If any provision of this act, or any application
   55  of any provision of this act, is held to be invalid,  or  ruled  by  any
   56  federal agency to violate or be inconsistent with any applicable federal

       A. 805                              6

    1  law  or  regulation, that shall not affect the validity or effectiveness
    2  of any other provision of this act, or of any other application  of  any
    3  provision of this act.
    4    S 7. This act shall take effect immediately; provided, however that:
    5    (a)  the  amendments  to  article 2-A of the public health law made by
    6  sections two and four of this act shall not affect the  repeal  of  such
    7  article and shall be deemed repealed therewith;
    8    (b)  section  five  of  this  act shall take effect on the one hundred
    9  eightieth day after this act shall have become a law;
   10    (c) any  rebate  payment  due  from  any  drug  manufacturer  and  any
   11  reimbursement  due under section 280-h of the public health law shall be
   12  paid notwithstanding the repeal of section 280-h made by section five of

   14    (d) the amendments to article 2-A of the public  health  law  made  by
   15  section  three  of  this  act shall survive the expiration and repeal of
   16  such article as provided in section 79 of part C of chapter  58  of  the
   17  laws of 2005, as amended.
